instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message:
Guys, i get this board to fix.
The fan spin and everything, but i don't get a chime.
Almost the rails is normal, but i get a couple low voltage and none rails bellow.

- <SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL> - 14.12V
- <SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTCIO</SIGNAL> - 0V
- <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 1.7V

Water damage <CHIP>U8160</CHIP> area and i fixed.


<CHIP>U2940</CHIP> ( I guess is bad):

VIN:
- <SIGNAL>TBT_EN_CIO_PWR</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
- <SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBT</SIGNAL> - 1.04V

VOUT:
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTCIO</SIGNAL> - 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message: TBT stands for thunderbolt and isn't something to worry about if it does not chime. How does the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
